channel.title: webkit on David Calhoun's blog
channel.description: Recent content in webkit on David Calhoun's blog

item.title: More fun with WebKit pseudoelements: -webkit-search-cancel-button (or: Pseudoclass Inception)
item.description: ⚠️ Warning: this is an old article and may include information that’s out of date. ⚠️ Introduction UPDATE 2016: this appears to have even less support than before, and it’s not recommended to be used on a production site. Use a helper JS library instead. (check out the Demo) A while back I had a bit of a field day messing around with input type=“range”, trying to replicate the “unlock slider” on iOS using CSS, targeting special WebKit-only CSS pseudoelements such as webkit-slider-thumb.

item.title: Using mobile-specific HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (Mobile web part 5)
item.description: ⚠️ Warning: this is an old article and may include information that’s out of date. ⚠️ (updated June 27, 2011) Mobile-specific HTML Viewport tag Use the viewport tag to properly fit the content to the screen: 1 <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" /> Tel scheme (to initiate phone calls) 1 <a href="tel:18005555555">Call us at 1-800-555-5555</a> Sms scheme (to initiate text messages) 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 <a href="sms:18005555555"> <a href="sms:18005555555,18005555556"> <!
